comments.body:
i think there's an advantage of running those scripts even if they do nothing.
it increases the test coverage.
so maybe consider putting the `if` inside the script?

The problem is we need to rely on the shebang because Sentinel can't accept multiple arguments as a script, and the location of tclsh varies between platforms. We could use `/usr/bin/env` and make sure we at least have that but I think the value is not high.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +42,46 @@        S $id SENTINEL SET mymaster failover-timeout 20000
        S $id SENTINEL SET mymaster parallel-syncs 10
        if {$::leaked_fds_file != "" && [exec uname] == "Linux"} {
            S $id SENTINEL SET mymaster notification-script ../../tests/helpers/check_leaked_fds.tcl
            S $id SENTINEL SET mymaster client-reconfig-script ../../tests/helpers/check_leaked_fds.tcl
